name: Bernstein-Vazirani Algorithm
description: Recover a hidden binary string s='101' from f(x) = s·x (mod 2) in a single oracle query.
long_description: The Bernstein-Vazirani algorithm recovers a secret string s ∈ {0,1}^n by evaluating f(x) = s·x (mod 2) exactly once, while the best classical algorithm requires n queries. The circuit is structurally identical to Deutsch-Jozsa, but the oracle is a CX on each bit position where s[i]=1. After the Hadamard at the output, measuring gives s exactly.

references.title: Bernstein & Vazirani (1997). Quantum Complexity Theory. SIAM J. Comput. 26(5)
